title: Tags
body:
## Overview

**Tags** are user-assigned notations for providers or provider locations. They can be used to search for providers and provider locations. Tags are categorized into four groups: System Generated, Global, Enterprise, and User.

## Creating Tags

To view all available tags and create new User tags, navigate to **Settings > Project Settings > Tags** tab, you can create your own tags. 

![](/cms/cms-assets/media/creating-tag.png)

![](/cms/cms-assets/media/creating-tag1.png)

Navigate to **User Tags**. Click on **Add User tag** button.

![](/cms/cms-assets/media/creating-tag2.png)

Enter the tag name to be added as a User Tag. Click the **Add Tag** button.

![](/cms/cms-assets/media/creating-tag3.png)

A success or unsuccessful message will be displayed. If successful, the tag will be added to the User Tag list.

![](/cms/cms-assets/media/creating-tag4.png)

## Deleting created Tags

When necessary, you can click on the delete icon to delete the created tag. A notification asking for confirmation of deleting the tag will be displayed. Select **Yes** to delete the existing tag.

![](/cms/cms-assets/media/deleteing-created-tag1.png)

![](/cms/cms-assets/media/deleting-created-tag2.png)

![](/cms/cms-assets/media/deleting-created-tag3.png)

## Using Tags in Search Criteria of Create a List

On the **Create a List** Provider List page, you can add tags to provider or provider locations. However, you cannot add tags to provider or provider locations within the search criteria page. Tags are assigned on the Provider Profile or in bulk on the Detail Results page.  

If you want to query the provider data based on previously assigned tags, select one or more from the list. If no tags are present in the list, that means no providers have been tagged. The list of tags within the criteria section consists of only tags assigned within the project.

If you want to ensure that each provider returned in the search has matched on all tags that you have selected, select the **must have all tags** check box.

The **Tagged** **with** and **Not tagged with** fields both work in the same manner.

![](/cms/cms-assets/media/tags_create-a-list.png)

## Tagging Providers

When you are on a Provider Profile, regardless of the path you took to get there, you can click on **Tags for provider at this location**. This will open a popup box. Click on the **+** icon to assign one or more tags to this provider at this location.

![](/cms/cms-assets/media/adding-tags-to-provider-profile1.png)

You can select the required tag from the list of tags available in the dropdown.

![](/cms/cms-assets/media/adding-tags-to-provider-profile2.png)

You can assign more than one tag depending on the relevance.

Click on the **Delete** icon to remove the **Select or create a tag** selection dropdown. 

Click on x to remove the already existing tag. 

![](/cms/cms-assets/media/adding-tags-to-provider-profile3.png)

## Bulk Tags

Bulk Tags are assigned on:

1. The **Provider List** displayed in the **Detail results** page of **Competitive Dashboard, Compare Networks, Create a List** and **Model Networks** modules and
2. **Recruitment** list displayed in **Detail Results** page of the **Recruitment** module. 

For example, **Inactive: Deceased** or **Recruiting: Credentialing**.

Procedure to add one or more tags:

1. Click the **Tags** button in the upper right corner of the Provider Profile or Detail Results page. 

   ![](/cms/cms-assets/media/tag.png)


   The Bulk Tagging dialog box will open, and check boxes will be displayed next to each provider in the list.

   ![](/cms/cms-assets/media/creatalist_details_tags.png)
2. Select the tagging level, **Provider** or **Provider at displayed location**.

   ![](/cms/cms-assets/media/bulk-tagging2.png)
3. Select the check boxes for the providers to which you want to apply a tag.
4. Select an existing tag from the dropdown list or create a new tag.

   ![](/cms/cms-assets/media/bulktagging3.png)
5. Click the Apply Tags button.

Tags will display within the Details List or Providers profile below the providerâ€™s name.  The tag icons are different for Provider Level and Provider at displayed location level.

![](/cms/cms-assets/media/creatalist_details_tags_icons.png)

Each have hover text messages. And each are links to open additional information.

![](/cms/cms-assets/media/creatalist_details_tags_hover.png)
shortDescription: Tags are user-assigned notations for providers or provider locations. They can be used to search for providers and provider locations.
